conversation.content: I'm really hoping you can help me because I'm completely lost here.
Oh! Policy confusion. Love these. Let me pull up. Your account. Real quick. Customer since 2019, account number ACC-4821-JV, and I can already see three orders this year.
Yeah exactly, I've been ordering forever and suddenly everything's different?
Right right. So. Big changes. October 15th. New return window dropped from 90 days to 30 days, and the free shipping threshold jumped from $35 to $75.
Wait, thirty days? I literally just tried to return something from September.
Ah! There it is. Order ORD-9924-LP from September 3rd. Yeah. Under old policy, you'd have until December 2nd. New policy cuts you off at October 3rd. Which was. Two weeks ago.
This is—I mean, I really needed to return this. My daughter can't even use it.
Okay okay. Here's what I'm seeing. The item—it's the art tablet for $189.99, right? So technically. Outside window. But. I'm checking your history here.
Did anyone even announce these changes? Because I check my email constantly.
So the announcement. Hmm. Email blast went out September 28th to all active customers, subject line "Important Account Updates," but our system shows only 12% open rate.
Of course it went to spam or something. This is just—sorry, I'm not mad at you.
No no, totally get it. Listen. I'm gonna—let me just—actually, you know what? Exception code EXC-7744-M lets me override return windows for customers with over 24 months history.
Oh my god, really? You're actually being so helpful right now.
Gets better. Since you missed the announcement—not your fault—I'm adding a courtesy credit of $15.00 to offset that new shipping threshold thing. Should post within 48 hours.
Wait, you can just do that? That's incredibly nice of you.
Trick is knowing which buttons. Return label RMA-5521-QZ is generating now. Should hit your email in about. Um. Five minutes? Ten max.
You know what, you've completely turned this day around. Seriously, thank you.
Best part? I'm noting your account so if any other old orders need returning before you knew about changes—just reference case number CSE-8823-YK.
That's so smart! Honestly, you should train everyone there.
Ha! Appreciated. But hey. Real quick. Want me to reactivate email notifications? Make sure nothing else sneaks past? Takes literally 30 seconds.

scenario: confused because the company's policies seem to have changed without notice
